name: handsomely

handsomely adverb
(VERY WELL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
very well or to a great degree: reward someone handsomely She said if his results were good, she would reward him handsomely.pay off handsomely Their strategy paid off handsomely.
More examplesFewer examplesThe two companies stood to profit handsomely if a casino opened.Some college heads will be more handsomely rewarded than others. Cloning advocates say plenty of people are seeking their services and are willing to pay handsomely.

handsomely adverb
(ATTRACTIVELY)
in a way that is physically attractive in a traditionally male way: At six feet, Bill was handsomely athletic. He was a man of about sixty, handsomely dressed.
More examplesFewer examplesHe has brown skin, thick eyebrows, and a handsomely aquiline nose.His face was delicately ruddy and handsomely featured.John was a large man, handsomely turned out in a three-button suit and a pastel silk tie.
